text: What is the simplest way to read in a csv.? Shouldn't it just be CSV.read("myfile.csv")?

elements.text: What is the simplest way to read in a csv.? Shouldn't it just be CSV.read("myfile.csv")?

text: It's not clear from those words thst I'm reading the file in

elements.text: It's not clear from those words thst I'm reading the file in

text: you can do `CSV.read(DataFrame, "myfile.csv")` (Or maybe the other way around)
the reason it's weird is because it's not obvious what the output type should be. CSV doesn't want to depend on DataFrames so it has to have its own "bare-bones" table type.

elements.text: the reason it's weird is because it's not obvious what the output type should be. CSV doesn't want to depend on DataFrames so it has to have its own "bare-bones" table type.

text:
`CSV.File` returns the CSV.File typed object, which is a kind of Table.
It's a perfectly good table type.
For many uses I use it without going to a DataFrame.

elements.text:

text:
Was there a discussion about `CSV.read(filename)=CSV.File(filename)` ?

That used to give a DataFrame.
But it's been a while since it did that do maybe we the method can be considered open again
